column4: hello ... I managed to screw up my fstab file ... what exactly should this file contain?
I did not
is it the same for all computers?
how would I go about creating one for my own computer then .....
isn't it mount points?
ah ok ... I'll google it ....
thanks
what all is in it?
just harddrive ... cd drives?
have a look at http://www.gentoo.org/doc/en/handbook/handbook-x86.xml?part=1&chap=8  :)
but ubuntu should have created it automatically for you
lol :)
type "whatis cat"
type "mount" and it should have most of your current information which you can copy out into a new fstab
does typing "mount" come up with a load of stuff?
yeah, then if it is broken you can boot off the livecd and fix it
no worries, the main ones you need to boot are (if you did a default partitioning) proc, your root, and swap space
proc will always be: proc            /proc           proc    defaults        0       0
and your root and swap you can get from the output of 'mount'
actually no... to check your swap partition type "cat /proc/swaps" and it will show your swap device there
good luck :)
